description: U.S. regional variation of champ (verb), from Middle English champen, chammen (“to bite; gnash”).

entries.meaning: (computing, rare) A unit of computing storage equal to sixteen bits, which can represent any of 65536 distinct values.
examples: An IPv6 address is represented as eight hexadecimal chomps.

verbs.description: chomp (third-person singular simple present chomps, present participle chomping, simple past and past participle chomped)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To bite or chew loudly or heavily.
examples: The dog chomped on the treat and swallowed it in one gulp.

entries.meaning: (computing, transitive, Perl) To remove the final character from (a text string) if it is a newline (or, less commonly, some other programmer-specified character).
